success.question_text: The tone of the article could best be described as

review_1.column_1_text:
Explanation

Click OPEN ANSWER PDF to see the lines highlighted in green. These lines show you where the answer can be found.

This is a judgement (evaluation) type of question because you have to work out how the author has written the text. 'Tone' refers to the writer’s attitude to the reader.

Tips for a judgement (evaluation) type of question

For some questions, you can find the answer in the text by reading and selecting sentences carefully and then making a judgement about the information provided, in order to work out the final answer.

For other questions, you will have to combine the facts that you read in the text with your own knowledge and observations, in order to work out the final answer.

choice_2.label: light and informative.

choice_3.label: formal and authoritarian.

Click OPEN ANSWER PDF to see the lines highlighted in green. These lines show you where the answer can be found.

This is an inferring (working out) type of question because you have to 'read between the lines' when you read part of the text. The clue is in “dry continent” (arid country) and 'the great outback'. A wilderness is an uninhabited area.

Tip for an inferring (working out) type of question

To find the answer you have to 'read between the lines' as this type of question is based on material that does not jump out and give you the answer straightaway. You need to know about material in the text and then combine it with your own knowledge and understanding to work out the final answer.

Explanation

This is an inferring (working out) type of question because you have to 'read between the lines' when you read part of the text. The clue is the couple didn't call the dogs off and then Yuri 'could feel his heart pounding' (was scared and upset).

Tip for an inferring (working out) type of question

To find the answer you have to 'read between the lines' as this type of question is based on material that does not jump out and give you the answer straightaway. You need to know about material in the text and then combine it with your own knowledge and understanding to work out the final answer.

success.question_text: What did Yuri find inconsistent about country towns?

review_1.column_1_text:
Explanation

Click OPEN ANSWER PDF to see the lines highlighted in green. These lines show you where the answer can be found.

This is a judgement (evaluation) type of question. The clue is that 'everyone was friendly' in country towns and the sign said 'Live in peace', but the people Yuri met weren't friendly or peaceful.

Tips for a judgement (evaluation) type of question

For some questions, you can find the answer in the text by reading and selecting sentences carefully and then making a judgement about the information provided, in order to work out the final answer.

For other questions, you will have to combine the facts that you read in the text with your own knowledge and observations, in order to work out the final answer.
